text:
**Numerator Simplification:**
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin A \left( 3 \cos^2 A + \cos^4 A + 3 \sin^2 A + \sin^2 A \cos^2 A \right) \\
&= \sin A \left[ 3(\cos^2 A + \sin^2 A) + \cos^2 A (\cos^2 A + \sin^2 A) \right] \\
&= \sin A \left[ 3(1) + \cos^2 A (1) \right] \\
&= \sin A (3 + \cos^2 A)
\end{aligned}
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph systematically simplifies the numerator by algebraic manipulation and identification of trigonometric identities, which is methodically breaking down the problem structure.
class-2-reason: Details the step-by-step algebraic expansion and consolidation of the numerator; each part is a direct implementation of algebraic simplification.

text:
**Denominator Simplification:**
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \tan A \left( \sec A - \sin A \tan A \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{1}{\cos A} - \sin A \cdot \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{1 - \sin^2 A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{\cos^2 A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \cos A \right) \\
&= \sin A
\end{aligned}
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph methodically simplifies the denominator using algebraic manipulation and trigonometric identities, showing step-by-step working toward simplification.
class-2-reason: Details the algebraic step-by-step simplification of the denominator, performing fractions and algebraic manipulation; this is the implementation phase.
